title: 108_s2225
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Montana Mineral Exchange Act" and includes definitions for clarity. The Act, known as the "Montana Mineral Exchange Act," defines key terms such as Ancillary Fund, Annual 6 percent amount, Annual tonnage, and Base sum. The "Montana Mineral Exchange Act" defines key terms like Base sum as the annual tonnage multiplied by 50 cents per ton, and Cheyenne tracts as specific land tracts within the Northern Cheyenne Reservation totaling approximately 5,000 acres. The "Montana Mineral Exchange Act" defines terms like exchange as the exchange of mineral rights and Federal tracts as unleased land in Montana totaling 5,000 acres. The "Montana Mineral Exchange Act" defines terms like exchange as the exchange of mineral rights and Federal tracts as unleased land in Montana totaling 5,000 acres. In T. 9 S., R. 40 E., sec. 4, SW\1/4\NW\1/4\, sec. 5, S\1/2\NE\1/4\ and SE\1/4\, sec. 8, NW\1/4\NE\1/4\NE\1/4\ and NW\1/4\NE\1/4\, sec. 24, lot 16 and SE\1/4\SE\1/4\, sec. 25, lots 9, 12, 13, 16, and E\1/2\E\1/2\, sec. 36, E\1/2\SE\1/4\, sec. 20, lots 1, 2, 3, and 4, E\1/2\NW\1/4\, E\1/2\NE\1/4\, SW\1/4\NE\1/4\, E\1/2\SW\1/4\, and SE\1/4\, sec. 21, SW\1/4\SW\1/4\, sec. 28, W\1/2\NW\1/4\, SW\1/4\, W\1/2\SE\1/4\, and NE\1/4\SE\1/4\. The "Montana Mineral Exchange Act" defines terms like exchange as the exchange of mineral rights and Federal tracts as unleased land in Montana totaling 5,000 acres. In T. 9 S., R. 40 E., sec. 4, SW\1/4\NW\1/4\, sec. 5, S\1/2\NE\1/4\ and SE\1/4\, sec. 8, NW\1/4\NE\1/4\NE\1/4\ and NW\1/4\NE\1/4\, sec. 24, lot 16 and SE\1/4\SE\1/4\, sec. 25, lots 9, 12, 13, 16, and E\1/2\E\1/2\, sec. 36, E\1/2\SE\1/4\, sec. 20, lots 1, 2, 3, and 4, E\1/2\NW\1/4\, E\1/2\NE\1/4\, SW\1/4\NE\1/4\, E\1/2\SW\1/4\, and SE\1/4\, sec. 21, SW\1/4\SW\1/4\, sec. 28, W\1/2\NW\1/4\, SW\1/4\, W\1/2\SE\1/4\, and NE\1/4\SE\1/4\. The term "Great Northern Properties" refers to Great Northern Properties Limited Partnership, a Delaware limited partnership, and any successor to the ownership interest of Great Northern Properties in the minerals underlying the Cheyenne tracts. The term "immediately preceding Permanent Fund years" refers to the 3 fiscal years before the current one, with exceptions for the second and third years. "Income" is defined as the total return from investments, including interest, dividends, gains, and losses. The Permanent Fund includes all income from investments, minus costs for management and services. It is established by the Northern Cheyenne Permanent Fund and has a fiscal year defined in the Permanent Fund plan. The Secretary of the Interior oversees it. The Permanent Fund, overseen by the Secretary of the Interior, includes all investment income, with costs deducted. The "trailing average Permanent Fund value" refers to the average quarterly market value in preceding years. The term "Tribe" specifically denotes the Northern Cheyenne Tribe. SEC. 3. MINERAL RIGHTS EXCHANGE. Great Northern Properties will convey its mineral interests in the Cheyenne tract to the United States, and in return, the Secretary will convey all mineral interests in Federal tracts to Great Northern Properties. The mineral interests underlying the Cheyenne tracts will be taken into trust for the Tribe by the Secretary.

SEC. 4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EXCHANGE. The Tribe will waive legal claims related to the failure of the United States to acquire private mineral interests for the Northern Cheyenne Reservation. A formula for revenue sharing from coal production must be agreed upon for the exchange to proceed. The exchange must be completed within 90 days after the agreement. Rescission of the exchange is possible after completion. If a court invalidates part of the exchange and the judgment is final, the Secretary or Great Northern Properties can rescind the entire exchange. SEC. 5. NORTHERN CHEYENNE PERMANENT FUND AND NORTHERN CHEYENNE ANCILLARY FUND. Establishment of the Northern Cheyenne Permanent Fund and Northern Cheyenne Ancillary Fund in the Treasury of the United States. Authorization of appropriations to the Permanent Fund for fiscal years 2005-2007 and to the Ancillary Fund for fiscal years 2008-2011. Transfers from the Ancillary Fund to the Permanent Fund by the Secretary of the Treasury after the end of each fiscal year starting from 2008. The Secretary transfers an amount from the Ancillary Fund to the Permanent Fund, determined by the base sum and any accrued income or loss. A written statement is provided to the Tribe after the transfer, detailing the amount and how it was calculated. The Tribe may expend up to 6 percent of the trailing average Permanent Fund value for education, law enforcement, tribal governmental services, and economic development starting from the second Permanent Fund fiscal year. The Tribe can use up to 6% of the Permanent Fund for education, law enforcement, tribal services, and economic development. No other expenditures from the fund are allowed for per capita payments or litigation against off-reservation projects. The Tribe must invest, manage, disburse, and expend funds from the Permanent Fund for specific purposes outlined in the plan. The Secretary can invest portions of the Permanent Fund in interest-bearing deposits and securities as requested by the Tribe, following specific Acts. All income earned on investments in the Permanent Fund must be deposited back into the fund. The Tribe must develop a Permanent Fund plan with the Secretary for managing and expending funds. Income from investments in the Ancillary Fund must be deposited back into that fund. The Tribe, in consultation with the Secretary, may revise and update the Permanent Fund plan. Federal disbursements from the Permanent Fund can be requested by the Tribe for purposes outlined in subsection (d)(1). The Tribe must adopt a Permanent Fund plan before receiving any funds, and the Secretary can enforce the plan to ensure proper use of withdrawn amounts. The Secretary and the Secretary of the Treasury will not be liable for the expenditure or investment of the amount withdrawn from the Permanent Fund. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations for carrying out this Act.
